title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 21 September 2015 - XWiki
content:
<msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:28 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
07:49 <Ramona1> has quit  
08:14 <cjd> has quit  
08:42 <Ramona2> has joined #xwiki  
08:42 <woshilapin> has quit  
08:45 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <vmassol> good morning  
09:15 <cjd> gm  
09:20 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki

09:54 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <silverdrop> has quit  
09:56 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <vmassol> just one issue left in jira for 7.2 final :) (for now!)  
10:02 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <vmassol> checking ci, 14 failures in platform  
10:15 <vmassol> must be something global  
10:15 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you mentioned you broke something on Thursday, was it fixed?  
10:15 <vmassol> (and gm)  
10:17 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <tmortagne> Hi guys  
10:24 <tmortagne> mflorea: is it only me or Skype is dead for you too ?  
10:24 <tmortagne> (asking you since you have the same system than me AFAIK)  
10:24 <vmassol> it's fine for me  
10:24 <vmassol> hi tmortagne  
10:24 <Enygma`> tmortagne: skype dead for me too  
10:25 <vmassol> hmm wait  
10:25 <tmortagne> ok so it's skype linux in general I guess  
10:25 <vmassol> it was ok a few minutes ago  
10:25 <tmortagne> it just died for me  
10:25 <vmassol> now everyone appears offline  
10:25 <mflorea> tmortagne: it was ok 30min ago  
10:25 <tmortagne> ok  
10:25 <mflorea> yes, same here, everyone offline  
10:25 <vmassol> it's back  
10:25 <tmortagne> mflorea: was or for me too 30 minutes ago :)  
10:25 <vmassol> not really  
10:25 <vmassol> but just got a message now  
10:25 <tmortagne> s/or/ok/  
10:26 <vmassol> even though the person appears offline  
10:26 <gdelhumeau> Hi vmassol: the borken tests are I said last week  
10:26 <Enygma`> seems to be relatively working now, but everybody shows up offline  
10:27 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I don't understand what you mean  
10:27 <gdelhumeau> I'm fixing them  
10:27 <vmassol> ok  
10:27 <mflorea> Enygma`: can you leave messages? I just tried and it doesn't work  
10:27 <Enygma`> (scratch what I`ve said about skype. Works only on LAN)  
10:27 <mflorea> ok  
10:27 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: related to document title?  
10:28 <vmassol> I cheked one check and this is failing now: assertEquals(spaceName, editPage.getDocumentTitle());  
10:28 <gdelhumeau> no  
10:28 <gdelhumeau> it's related to the fact that we always havce the create form now when you create a page  
10:28 <vmassol> see http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-index-test-tests/testReport/org.xwiki.index.test.ui/SpacesTest/spacesMacro/  
10:28 <vmassol> you said you're fixing the tests  
10:28 <gdelhumeau> previously, you would be redirected to the edit mode  
10:28 <vmassol> which ones?  
10:28 <vmassol> all? :)  
10:29 <gdelhumeau> all that are related to that  
10:29 <gdelhumeau> when the tests assumes to have the edit mode  
10:29 <vmassol> I want to know if I can help on some test  
10:29 <gdelhumeau> and now they have the create form  
10:29 <vmassol> is http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-index-test-tests/testReport/org.xwiki.index.test.ui/SpacesTest/spacesMacro/ related to "that" for ex?  
10:29 <gdelhumeau> yes  
10:29 <vmassol> ok  
10:29 <vmassol> ok I understand now  
10:29 <vmassol> thanks  
10:31 <ldubost> has quit  
10:32 <cjd> https://twitter.com/cjdelisle/status/645875039443750913 :)  
10:33 <vmassol> cjd: it's not p2p  
10:33 <vmassol> AFAIK  
10:33 <cjd> not anymore lol  
10:33 <cjd> https://twitter.com/hashtag/Skype?src=hash  
10:33 <silverdrop> has quit  
10:34 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <mouhb> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <cjd> hey mouhb, welcome to the network  
10:35 <mouhb> Hey Caleb, thx  
10:36 <cjd> This is a wonderful example of HOW FAST people get upset when chat/email type services go offline  
10:37 <cjd> DCC chat won't work  
10:39 <mflorea> tmortagne, $xwiki.getURL($docRef) doesn't take into account the locale of the passed doc ref. Don't you think it should? i.e. it should return /bin/view/A/B/C?language=xx  
10:39 <mflorea> vmassol: wdyt?  
10:40 <vmassol> mflorea: yes I agree it should. We should take into account the Locale everywhere we pass it inside a ref IMO  
10:40 <mflorea> ok, good, I'll make the change then  
10:48 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: the page type is now displayed in the create form every time, even if there is no template provider and there is no office server configured?  
10:48 <gdelhumeau> yes  
10:48 <Enygma`> why?  
10:49 <gdelhumeau> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12580?focusedCommentId=87987&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-87987  
10:50 <Slashman> has quit  
10:51 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: did you consider consistency with the rest of the form`s inputs?  
10:52 <gdelhumeau> wdym?  
10:52 <Enygma`> atm, if the document location is specified, the form does not ask it again  
10:53 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <gdelhumeau> indeed, it's a big change  
10:53 <Enygma`> but actually this is not really the same thing  
10:53 <Enygma`> I don`t really think it`s ok to always display the type  
10:53 <benoitc> has quit  
10:53 <Enygma`> when your only option is "Blank page"  
10:54 <Enygma`> it should be default  
10:54 <Enygma`> like we did for the templateprovider parameter  
10:55 <gdelhumeau> Indeed, but to do that, right now, I have to add a dependency between oldcore and the office importer  
10:55 <gdelhumeau> to check:  
10:55 <gdelhumeau> 1/ if OfficeImporter ui exists in the wiki  
10:55 <gdelhumeau> 2/ if the openoffice server is connected  
10:56 <gdelhumeau> since, in some previous comments, people said that always having the form should be better (to avoid the WTF effect), I did this  
11:00 <benoitc> has joined #xwiki  
11:00 <Enygma`> then we should at least be consistent in the document location as well  
11:00 <Enygma`> i.e. pressing the create button on a document that does not exist should also display the document location inputs  
11:01 <Enygma`> the only case when we should hide the document location should be when the create UI is requested by javascript (in the Wanted Links document creation popup)  
11:01 <gdelhumeau> indeed  
11:01 <gdelhumeau> and BTW, because of the current behaviour  
11:02 <gdelhumeau> we cannot create form the UI a page in whatever location if Main.WebHome does not exist  
11:02 <gdelhumeau> \*from  
11:03 <Enygma`> not necessarily Main.WebHome, but we need an existing document first, yes..  
11:03 <Enygma`> or otherwise first navigate to that page and then create it  
11:03 <Enygma`> it`s the way it was initially implemented  
11:03 <Enygma`> but I agree that we need to improve it  
11:04 <gdelhumeau> We need an agreement for 7.2  
11:05 <gdelhumeau> my change was done because of XWIKI-12580  
11:15 <zoubir> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <sidali> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 \* cjd welcome to zoubir and sidali :)  
11:18 <zoubir> Hello All  
11:18 <zoubir> Thanks cjd  
11:18 <sidali> thanks Caleb  
11:23 <vmassol> party time, everyone's joining irc today :)  
11:25 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <yacine> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <cjd> welcome to acotiuga and yacine too :)  
11:26 <acotiuga> Hello, thanks :)  
11:28 <cjd> For people who don't know what all the new joiners are for, XWiki SAS (an XWiki service company) primarily uses skype to communicate internally and since skype is down, people are borrowing the XWiki project channel as a meetup place (hope you don't mind)  
11:28 <yacine> Hi, Thanks  
11:29 <cjd> For XWiki(SAS) people, you can use    /msg <name of somebody> <message>   to talk to somebody in private and you can use  /join #<name of your team>   to create or join a channel for your specific group  
11:29 <vmassol> provided the discussion is about public stuff and about xwiki open source project, no problem :)  
11:30 <cjd> Yeah, also please note that anything said in \*this\* channel is public knowledge (it's even publically logged)  
11:43 <gsmeria> has quit  
11:49 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:03 <gsmeria> has quit  
12:12 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
12:30 <silverdrop> has quit  
12:33 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
12:39 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:49 <yacine> has quit  
13:00 <Ramona2> has quit  
13:00 <Ramona2> has joined #xwiki  
13:02 <vmassol> Enygma`, gdelhumeau:  did we agree in the end about the create ui for 7.2?  
13:04 <gdelhumeau> we should always display the location too IMO, but it could wait for 7.3  
13:07 <vmassol> I mean we force the step to chooe the type of page to create in 7.2 or not?  
13:07 <vmassol> \*choose  
13:07 <vmassol> (not sure what location means in your last message)  
13:08 <ldubost> has quit  
13:09 <gdelhumeau> It's what I want and Enygma` did not oppose  
13:09 <vmassol> ok  
13:10 <vmassol> note that adding an extension point is also possibly not that complex  
13:10 <vmassol> but we could add it in 7.3+  
13:10 <Enygma`> I agree to doing this if we start doing it for the page location as well  
13:10 <Enygma`> otherwise it does not make much sense  
13:14 <Enygma`> page location = location picker (left section / left column) of the create UI form, since it can be hidden if you are on an nonexistent document for instance  
13:44 <acotiuga> has quit  
13:48 <vmassol> guys I'm going to move the master details tutorial in the debguide  
13:48 <vmassol> \*devguide  
13:48 <vmassol> shout if you don't agree :)  
14:03 <Ramona2> has quit  
14:03 <Ramona3> has joined #xwiki  
14:08 <sidali> has quit  
14:23 <zoubir> has quit  
14:51 <vmassol> bb in 15mn  
14:59 <Ramona3> has quit  
15:01 <msmeria> has quit  
15:15 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: what's your status re CI tests? I see a lot are still failing. Do you need help somewhere?  
15:15 <gdelhumeau> i'm fixing http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-administration-test-tests/1890/testReport/org.xwiki.administration.test.ui/CreatePageTest/createPageWithSaveAndEditTemplate/  
15:16 <gdelhumeau> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-office-test-tests/1890/testReport/ shoudl work now because fabio have installed libre office in jenkins-agent  
15:16 <gdelhumeau> these ones seems to be new: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-repository-test-tests/1890/testReport/  
15:17 <gdelhumeau> -ones ^^  
15:20 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: will check these 2, probably my fault  
15:24 <gdelhumeau> thanks  
15:25 <tmortagne> (almost done will a something and will check after)  
15:28 <tmortagne> mflorea: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-7.2.x/lastBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-repository-test-tests/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.repository/RepositoryTest/testAddExtension/ seems to be caused by your change on space Solr field  
15:28 <tmortagne> java.lang.ClassCastException: java.util.ArrayList cannot be cast to java.lang.String  
15:28 <mflorea> ok  
15:29 <tmortagne> use to be a single String and the code now ends up with an unexpected String[] I guess  
15:29 <mflorea> yes  
15:29 <tmortagne> might break other use things and be a bit too dangerous  
15:29 <tmortagne> s/use//  
15:30 <mflorea> I doubt it's used that much, and I see it in line with the other breaking changes related to nested spaces  
15:30 <mflorea> I'll document this breaking change  
15:31 <tmortagne> changing a type from String to String[] is not really like having a String name become a String reference  
15:33 <mflorea> yes, but if you use this field there's a high chance you need to update your code to handle nested spaces so you just need to do one more change  
15:33 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
15:36 <gsmeria> has quit  
15:38 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
15:42 <tmortagne> mflorea: you change it when you want to support nested spaces, here you are simply broken as soon as you upgrade...  
15:46 <mflorea> yes, I know, but I still think this breakage is acceptable, because even if you don't care about nested spaces, you still have issues with space names containing a dot, so you still need to update the extension code to work properly.  
15:52 <tmortagne> mflorea: space name containing a dot is not really the most common use case...  
15:53 <tmortagne> saying that WE should be extra careful about things like that in a generic code is not the same as breaking an extension that produce and request content which never ends up in a space with a dot (because the space is generated for example or cleaned for other reasons)  
15:55 <tmortagne> space is a pretty core field be it in the model or rest so changing its type does not sounds like a great move for me, it's pretty much like we had changed the return type of XWikiDocument#getSpace()  
15:55 <gsmeria> has quit  
15:55 <tmortagne> s/rest/solr/  
16:00 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
16:26 <ldubost2> has joined #xwiki  
16:29 <ldubost> has quit  
16:29 <ldubost2> is now known as <ldubost>  
16:48 <mouhb> has quit  
17:10 <gdelhumeau> LibreOffice has been installed on the 9 jenkins agents  
17:10 <gdelhumeau> It's under /opt/libreoffice3.6  
17:11 <gdelhumeau> However, the functionnal tests are failing  
17:11 <gdelhumeau> maybe the path is not good?  
17:11 <gdelhumeau> XWiki is not supposed to guess it?  
17:11 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: only if it's in the default path  
17:12 <gdelhumeau> I see  
17:12 <vmassol> jodconverter has some default locations  
17:12 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
17:12 <gdelhumeau> maybe we should add a symbolic link?  
17:13 <vmassol> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Office+Importer+Application#HPrerequisites26InstallationInstructions  
17:13 <vmassol> "If your XWiki instance fails to automatically locate the install path of the OO server, here are some default install paths of the OO on different operating systems:"  
17:13 <vmassol> (gdelhumeau)  
17:16 <gdelhumeau> then we should create a symbolic link /opt/openoffice.org3/ -> /opt/libreoffice3.6  
17:16 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: can we do this or should I ask to the infra?  
17:17 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: we could make the office module look for an environment variable, sounds cleaner to me and could be useful to others  
17:18 <tmortagne> so check the configuration, then some environment var (we do it for permanent dir for example), then let jodconvert do whatever it wants  
17:19 <gdelhumeau> do we have a failback mechanism for OO?  
17:20 <tmortagne> I don't understand the question  
17:20 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: WDYM?  
17:20 <vmassol> we have xwiki.properties  
17:20 <gdelhumeau> how can we know that the configuration is not good?  
17:20 <tmortagne> we already have a openoffice.homePath property  
17:21 <gdelhumeau> removing the default value of https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-office/xwiki-platform-office-importer/src/main/java/org/xwiki/officeimporter/internal/server/DefaultOfficeServerConfiguration.java#L106-106 ?  
17:21 <tmortagne> you get null when it's not set  
17:22 <tmortagne> yes when you tell getProperty to give you this.defaultHomePath when nothing is then then you get this.defaultHomePath when nothing is set :)  
17:22 <tmortagne> but you can also not give anything and check for null  
17:35 <gsmeria> has left #xwiki  
17:47 <gdelhumeau> actually there is already an environnement variable defined in JOD converter  
17:47 <gdelhumeau> https://github.com/mirkonasato/jodconverter/blob/master/jodconverter-core/src/main/java/org/artofsolving/jodconverter/office/OfficeUtils.java#L64  
17:49 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: better use this link: https://github.com/xwiki/jodconverter/blob/master/jodconverter-core/src/main/java/org/artofsolving/jodconverter/office/OfficeUtils.java#L70 ;)  
17:49 <vmassol> but yes it seems it exists, cool  
17:49 <tmortagne> ok even better the (we should probably still document it on our side)  
17:52 <gdelhumeau> I've set it to the xwiki-platform job  
17:57 \* cjd is doing something aweful  
17:57 <cjd> lets see if this works :D  
17:57 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: would be better to set it in the agents configuration I think  
17:57 <tmortagne> like http://ci.xwiki.org/computer/agent-1-1/configure  
17:58 <woshilapin> has quit  
17:58 <vmassol> cjd: re http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WebSocket?viewer=changes&rev2=24.1 have you remembered to add the property relocation property in your pom.xml?  
17:59 <vmassol> has quit  
17:59 <cjd> err  
17:59 <cjd> what's that? :)  
17:59 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:59 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: ok  
18:00 <vmassol> sorry hit the wrong kry :)  
18:00 <vmassol> \*key  
18:00 <cjd> vmassol: hmm what's that ?  
18:00 <vmassol> to tell EM that it's the same extension so that it can upgrade it  
18:00 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: actually up can even set it once in http://ci.xwiki.org/configure  
18:00 <cjd> ok awesome, that's kind of what I'm looking for  
18:00 <cjd> I have some old versions which were done manually and now I spent the afternoon working on a maven release  
18:00 <cjd> so now I need to port it over  
18:01 <cjd> #mess  
18:01 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: thx  
18:01 <vmassol> cjd: see http://contrib.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#HImplementingyourMavenbuild  
18:02 <vmassol> check the part that starts with "If you've modified the groupId or artifactId of the extension "  
18:02 <cjd> argh  
18:02 <cjd> ok  
18:02 <tmortagne> or http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+Commons+-+Extension+-+Repository+-+Maven#HCustomproperties  
18:04 <cjd> so I'm to understand this:   <xwiki.extension.name>Your extension's name</xwiki.extension.name>   <-- this will define the name of the document in extensions:Extensions.$x subwiki ?  
18:05 <cjd> mainly my problem seems to be that xwiki.org is not syncing w/ nexus  
18:07 <cjd> hmm seems not many extensions are released through nexus  
18:08 <tmortagne> cjd: depends what you are looking at, many recent extension are released through nexus  
18:08 <cjd> anyway I found one  
18:08 <tmortagne> <xwiki.extension.name> replace <name> in all possible ways from EM point of view  
18:08 <cjd> ok  
18:09 <tmortagne> but usually you don't need <xwiki.extension.name>  
18:09 <tmortagne> in platform we decided to have some strict too technical standard for <name> but usually contrib extension directly set a nice <name>  
18:09 <cjd> My situation is I have an existing extension released by attaching a jar, it has quite a nice wiki page  
18:09 <cjd> now I want to move to sync-from-nexus  
18:10 <tmortagne> this is a common use case yes, no problem, it will keep existing releases and add new ones  
18:10 <cjd> ok so I just need to re-release with <name> specified ?  
18:10 <tmortagne> the URL won't change whatever you put in <name>  
18:10 <tmortagne> all you need to do is making sure your extension page have the new id  
18:11 <cjd> 18:10 <+tmortagne> the URL won't change whatever you put in <name>   <-- you mean the URL \*will\* be what I put in <name>   ??  
18:11 <tmortagne> so that the importer update your page instead of creating a new one  
18:11 <tmortagne> cjd: no I mean you already have an URL  
18:11 <tmortagne> the importer won't touch it  
18:11 <tmortagne> you you were to create a new page then yes it would be used for the URL  
18:12 <tmortagne> s/you you/if you/  
18:12 <cjd> ok so putting <name>WebSocket</name> is core for Extension/WebSocket ??  
18:12 <tmortagne> again that's if you create a new extension page but that's not your use case  
18:12 <cjd> I'm just trying to confirm  
18:12 <cjd> err   ok so putting <name>WebSocket</name> is correct for existing page Extension/WebSocket ??  
18:13 <tmortagne> for existing page the only thing <name> will change is the page title  
18:13 <vmassol> your name is good cjd: <name>WebSocket Integration</name>  
18:13 <cjd> ahh ok  
18:13 <vmassol> from https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-contrib-websocket/blob/master/pom.xml  
18:13 <cjd> I'm looking for how to make it sync correctly  
18:13 <tmortagne> cjd: just make sure you have the right id  
18:14 <cjd> ok  
18:14 <tmortagne> in the ExtensionClass object  
18:14 <vmassol> description is ok too  
18:14 <vmassol> <description>Allows you to create WebSocket enabled Applications in XWiki</description>  
18:14 <tmortagne> the importer will match the id in that page and update it instead of creating a new one  
18:14 <vmassol> xwiki.version is strange though  
18:14 <cjd> ok so I just wait until tomorrow ?  
18:15 <cjd> in order for it to import...  
18:15 <vmassol> it says 7.1.2  
18:15 <tmortagne> you click import  
18:15 <cjd> ahh right
